title: Carnage at Southampton's 4-0 demolition of bitter rivals Portsmouth sees five fans arrested
text:
Hampshire Police have confirmed that five arrests were made after Portsmouth and Southampton fans clashed either side of their Carabao Cup clash on Tuesday night.

The third-round fixture, which Saints won 4-0 at Fratton Park, was the first South Coast derby since 2012.

Social media footage showed a series of scuffles between fans and police before and after the match, one supporter even punching a horse before being chased down the street and restrained by its mounted officer and his colleagues.

A Portsmouth fan appeared to punch a horse during a clash with Southampton supporters

The officer on the horse then chased the fan down the street before he is surrounded

'We can confirm that we made five arrests,' a post-match statement from Hampshire Constabulary read.

A later statement said: 'A 52-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of animal cruelty and attempt criminal damage. He has been released from custody but remains under investigation.

'Dean Baigrie, 40, of Taplings Close, Winchester, has been charged with possession of a firework/flare at a sporting event and throwing a missile onto a football playing area. He is due to appear at Portsmouth Magistrates Court on October 31.'

Hampshire Police also revealed that the other three to be arrested had been released, two with a conditional caution for a public order offence and one with no further action to be taken.

The incident involving the horse came after an officer was hurled to the floor as supporters pushed and shoved each other before the game.

A sea of authorities had to huddle around the two sets of fans to guide them into Fratton Park.

A sea of authorities had to huddle around the two sets of fans to guide them into Fratton Park

Coins, bottles and smoke grenades were also thrown as pockets of abuse and violence broke out around the stadium.

Assistant Chief Constable Scott Chilton said: 'Our priority was to keep people safe and I'm pleased to be able to say this morning that our policing operation has achieved that.

'We knew that the majority of fans wanted to enjoy this match without having to worry about their safety and we did what we felt was needed to reassure them.

'Sadly we had to prepare for the potential that a minority would try and ruin it for everyone else and this required us, in conjunction with both clubs and our partners, to put plans in place to ensure we were ready to stop that.

A police officer was thrown to the floor during a clash between the two sets of fans

'As expected, due to the nature of the routes to and from Fratton Park, there were times where groups of opposing fans came into close proximity to one another.

'However, as a result of our careful planning we were able to keep these groups apart and get them to and from the stadium safely.

'I think the fact that we have had no reports of anyone being injured and only a few people arrested is testament to the hard work that everyone has put into this operation.

'I would like to thank the fans for supporting our officers throughout the day and for those who helped us during the planning process.

Danny Ings (front) sinks to his knees and celebrates in front of the fans at Fratton Park

'Today everyone is talking about what happened on the pitch, not off it, which is exactly what we wanted.'

The Hampshire Constabulary had to draft in officers from outside the county, including Kent and Thames Valley authorities.

The emergency services used horses, dogs, helicopters and drones to disperse angry crowds.

Before the match, Hampshire Constabulary insisted it would be their largest ever football policing operation.
description: Hampshire Police have confirmed that five arrests were made after Portsmouth and Southampton fans clashed either side of their Carabao Cup clash on Tuesday night.
